result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.  Attorney Robert Taylor on behalf of Attorney Amanda J. Olsen in court for Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman.  Prosecuting Attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Sgt. - B. LaRoque. Court took judicial notice of 19CF395. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Taylor in court for Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr. Cleveland-Coleman is housed at MSDF, they did not have him scheduled to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen in court for Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman. Attorney Jon Josephsen appeared on behalf of Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for State V. Lee hearing. Defendant was not produced for hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Amanda J. Olsen  has been appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Parties selected Preliminary hearing date. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing, Branch 16.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Received and Filed.
Attorney Amanda Kremer.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

OFF THE RECORD- Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for State V Lee Hearing. Defendant not produced. Court adjourns matter for an additional State V Lee Hearing so defendant can be present. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman in court by video, defendant in custody at MSDF.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Case is adjourned. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Appointment status letter; Received and Filed.

Defendant Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Deonte L Cleveland-Coleman in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense motion to dismiss enhancers (939.6195(2)) Mandatory Minimum-Repeat Firearm Crimes AND (939.62(1)(b)) Habitual Criminality Repearter due to legislation issues, state argues, court denied motion.
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-22-2022 @2p
